duties_responsibilities.duty: Convert all purchase requisitions into purchase orders within one business day and follow up on order confirmations with vendor to ensure on-time delivery.
Maintain all SAP objects needed for the purposes of placing orders (source lists, info records, outline agreements, pricing, vendors, etc.).
Support all automation aspects of an Operational Buyer desk to ensure efficiency optimization and a streamlined desk.
Work with North America Master Data to ensure setup of vendors or changes to existing vendors as needed to ensure the proper issuance of purchase orders.
Reviews purchase requisitions from internal stakeholders to ensure accuracy and adherence to Global Procurement & Logistics Departments Policy and Procedure Guidelines.
Collaborates with internal stakeholders to ensure sourced goods and services meet business needs.
Confers with Suppliers to obtain product or service information such as price, availability, and lead time.
Work in conjunction with accounts payable, business units, and warehousing to resolve delivery, pricing, and goods/receipts/payment issues for the area of responsibility.
Plan and prioritize work to meet commitments aligned with organizational goals.
Ability to independently negotiate, anticipate and identify problems, analyze correctly, consider alternatives, implement the right solution, and monitor results.

Proven organizational skills to manage multiple projects simultaneously, with minimal supervision. Including the ability to organize diverse information, analyze and resolve disputes, understand internal customer requirements, and make independent decisions.
Basic understanding of management accounting principles and financial analysis skills are preferred.
Ability to work well in a virtual team environment with peers, business partners, and end-users.

education_certification.credential: BA/BS in Supply Chain Management/Procurement, Business, Finance, or other related field. Less than 3 years of experience. SAP experience a plus.
